intro: Eriogonum minutiflorum, commonly known as the dwarf flax or stickybark, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the buckwheat family (Polygonaceae) and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has a low, spreading growth habit with hairy stems and leaves. Eriogonum minutiflorum is often found in chaparral and coastal sage scrub habitats.
